about.name: Andy Deng
about.title: CS Student @ Boston College
about.description: Hello! I am Andy Deng, and I am a current junior studying Computer Science and Finance at Boston College. I have a passion for building meaningful  software in a supportive and collaborative environment! I have experience in many stages of software development including both front-end and back-end. I am proficient in languages such as JavaScript, Java, Python and have quality experience working with OCaml and C++. I hope to never stop learning and use my skills and experience to contribute to something that has true meaning.
about.interests_desc: Interests: Web Development, Machine Learning, Software Engineering, Graphics/Visual computing

events.title: Working for Boston College IT Services

projects.title: Instagram Copy
projects.description: This project is a partial clone of instagram that I created using React. It includes a home page, a profile page, and a way to upload new posts. It utilizes React Router to support various navigations in the app and saves user data into a remote database using Firestore.

projects.title: Recursion Teaching Tool
projects.description: After interviewing numerous CS students, we noticed that an overwhelming majority of them listed recursion as the most challenging topic to understand. Our website is designed around the goal of having visual tools, practice problems, and other resources available all in one place to aid course material. It designed around user testing and feedback to optimize user experience.

events.title: RL Coach for Vanta Leagues
events.description: Coached 6 students ages 9-14 using Google Classroom and managed 2 weekly coaching sessions and 1 weekly game day. Prioritized a non-toxic, supportive, and safe learning environment.

events.title: IT Help Desk
events.description: Worked at the IT Help Desk for Boston College IT Services. Helped students and faculty with printing and internet issues and managed printers across campus.
